meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unidimensional.
meanings.sent1: The unidimensionality of the line made it easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting lacked depth due to its unidimensionality.
meanings.sent3: The unidimensionality of the character's personality was comically exaggerated.
meanings.sent4: The unidimensionality of the situation left no room for interpretation.
meanings.sent5: The unidimensionality of the puzzle made it simple to solve.

meanings.definition: The concept of existing in only one dimension.
meanings.sent1: In physics, the idea of unidimensionality simplifies certain calculations.
meanings.sent2: The unidimensionality of the graph made it easy to analyze.
meanings.sent3: The unidimensionality of the story's plot was surprisingly engaging.
meanings.sent4: The unidimensionality of the argument left no room for compromise.
meanings.sent5: The unidimensionality of the music score made it sound flat.
